created.title: Date Created
created.description: The date at which this Configuration was created.

type.title: Type
type.description: A type ID for this connector.

pipeline.title: Pipeline ID
pipeline.description: Name of the IndexPipeline used for processing output.

diagnosticLogging.title: Diagnostic Logging
diagnosticLogging.description: Enable diagnostic logging; disabled by default

parserId.title: Parser ID
parserId.description: The Parser to use in the associated IndexPipeline.

fetchSettings.title: Fetch Settings
fetchSettings.description: System level settings for controlling fetch behavior and performance.

pluginInstances.title: Number of plugin instances for distributed fetching
pluginInstances.description: Maximum number of plugin instances for distributed fetching. Only specified number of plugin instanceswill do fetching. This is useful for distributing load between different instances.

fetchItemQueueSize.title: Fetch Item Queue Size
fetchItemQueueSize.description: Size of the fetch item queue.Larger values result in increased memory usage, but potentially higher performance.Default is 10k.

fetchRequestCheckInterval.title: Fetch request check interval(ms)
fetchRequestCheckInterval.description: The amount of time to wait before check if a request is done

fetchResponseScheduledTimeout.title: Fetch response scheduled timeout(ms)
fetchResponseScheduledTimeout.description: The maximum amount of time for a response to be scheduled. The task will be canceled if this setting is exceeded.

numFetchThreads.title: Fetch Threads
numFetchThreads.description: Maximum number of fetch threads; defaults to 20.This setting controls the number of threads that call the Connectors fetch method.Higher values can, but not always, help with overall fetch performance.

fetchResponseCompletedTimeout.title: Fetch response completion timeout(ms)
fetchResponseCompletedTimeout.description: The maximum amount of time for a response to be completed. If exceeded, the task will be retried if the job is still running

indexingInactivityTimeout.title: Indexing inactivity timeout(seconds)
indexingInactivityTimeout.description: The maximum amount of time to wait for indexing results (in seconds). If exceeded, the job will fail with an indexing inactivity timeout.

pluginInactivityTimeout.title: Plugin inactivity timeout(seconds)
pluginInactivityTimeout.description: The maximum amount of time to wait for plugin activity (in seconds). If exceeded, the job will fail with a plugin inactivity timeout.

asyncParsing.title: Async Parsing
asyncParsing.description: When enabled, content will be indexed asynchronously.

indexingThreads.title: Index Subscription Threads
indexingThreads.description: Maximum number of indexing threads; defaults to 4.This setting controls the number of threads in the indexing service used for processing content documents emitted by this datasource.Higher values can sometimes help with overall fetch performance.

indexContentFields.title: Index content fields
indexContentFields.description: When enabled, content fields will be indexed to the crawl-db collection.

indexMetadata.title: Index metadata
indexMetadata.description: When enabled the metadata of skipped items will be indexed to the content collection.

modified.title: Date Modified
modified.description: The date at which this Configuration was last modified.

id.title: Configuration ID
id.description: A unique identifier for this Configuration.

sitecorePassword.title: SiteCore password
sitecorePassword.description: The password of the administrator user

itemPaths.title: Item paths to index
itemPaths.description: A list of SiteCore Item paths to be indexed ex. '/sitecore/content/Home'

sitecoreDatabase.title: SiteCore context database
sitecoreDatabase.description: SiteCore context database to use when accessing SiteCore. For example: master, web, core. If you leave this blank, the connector will pick the default database associated with your current user.

indexMetadata.title: Index item metadata
indexMetadata.description: If enabled, the item metadata will be added to the indexed document

fetchRetryProperties.title: Retry Options
fetchRetryProperties.description: A set of options for configuring retry behavior.

maxRetries.title: Maximum Retries
maxRetries.description: The retryer will retry failed operations in the case that they might succeed if attempted again. This parameter states the number of attempts to retry until giving up. This parameter, if specified, will override the "Stop retrying after time (milliseconds)" parameter.

delayFactor.title: Delay Factor
delayFactor.description: The retryer will retry failed operations in the case that they might succeed if attempted again. The retryer will sleep an exponential amount of time after the first failed attempt and retry in exponentially incrementing amounts after each failed attempt up to the maximumTime. nextWaitTime = exponentialIncrement * multiplier.

delayMs.title: Retry Delay
delayMs.description: Sets the delay between retries, exponentially backing off to the maxDelayTimeMs and multiplying successive delays by the delayFactor

maxDelayTimeMs.title: Maximum Delay Time
maxDelayTimeMs.description: The maximum time wait time between successive retries.

maxTimeLimitMs.title: Maximum Time Limit
maxTimeLimitMs.description: This setting is used to limit the maximum amount of time spent on retries. Note: this will be ignored if "Maximum Retries" is specified.

errorExclusions.title: Error Exclusions
errorExclusions.description: Optional regex list that will be matched against failed attempts exception class and message. If any regex matches, do not retry this request. This is needed to prevent the retryer from retrying non-recoverable errors that were not already ignored by the connector implementation.

connections.title: Http client connection options
connections.description: A set of options for configuring the http client behavior.

ignoreSSLValidationExceptions.title: Ignore SSL Validation Exceptions
ignoreSSLValidationExceptions.description: Do not attempt to do an SSL Handshake and do not verify the hostname of SSL certificates. Use this when accessing an https url with a self-signed or enterprise certificate authority that you do not want to put in the Java keystore.

timeouts.title: Http timeout options
timeouts.description: A set of options for configuring the http client timeouts.

proxyProperties.title: Proxy options
proxyProperties.description: A set of options for configuring the proxy.

sizeLimitProperties.title: Item Size Limits
sizeLimitProperties.description: Options for including or excluding items based on size, in bytes.

maxSizeBytes.title: Maximum
maxSizeBytes.description: Used for excluding items when the item size is larger than the configured value.

minSizeBytes.title: Minimum
minSizeBytes.description: Used for excluding items when the item size is smaller than the configured value.

includedFileExtensions.title: Included file extensions
includedFileExtensions.description: Set of file extensions to be fetched. If specified, all non-matching files will be skipped.

excludedFileExtensions.title: Excluded file extensions
excludedFileExtensions.description: A set of all file extensions to be skipped from the fetch.

regexCacheSize.title: Regex Cache Size
regexCacheSize.description: The number of regex matches to cache when evaluating regular expressions. For example if you exclude files by filename, each filename's regex result will be cached so that if this same filename came up again, the regex matches would be remembered.

inclusiveRegexes.title: Inclusive regexes
inclusiveRegexes.description: Regular expressions for URI patterns to include. This will limit this datasource to only URIs that match the regular expression.

exclusiveRegexes.title: Exclusive regexes
exclusiveRegexes.description: Regular expressions for URI patterns to exclude. This will limit this datasource to only URIs that do not match the regular expression.

regexCacheSize.title: Regex Cache Size
regexCacheSize.description: The number of regex matches to cache when evaluating regular expressions. For example if you exclude files by filename, each filename's regex result will be cached so that if this same filename came up again, the regex matches would be remembered.

maxDepth.title: Maximum Item Depth
maxDepth.description: Maximum depth level for fetch items. If an item has a depth greater than the configured value, it will not be fetched. The default is "no limit" (-1).

mimeTypeProperties.title: MIME Types
mimeTypeProperties.description: Options for including or excluding items, based on MIME types.

includedMimeTypes.title: Included mime types
includedMimeTypes.description: A list of the Mime types to include in this crawl. Note: If you specify includes, the exclude mime types property will be ignored.

excludedMimeTypes.title: Excluded mime types
excludedMimeTypes.description: A list of the Mime types to exclude from this crawl. NOTE: This is only used if the "Mime Type Includes" field is empty.

databaseProperties.title: Database properties
databaseProperties.description: A set of options for configuring the connection to the database used for incremental crawls.

sitecoreDatabaseHost.title: SiteCore database JDBC host
sitecoreDatabaseHost.description: The SiteCore SQL Server host. Example: 192.168.1.59 Note: This is only needed for faster incremental updates. If not specified, updates will be done with a recrawl strategy.

sitecoreDatabasePort.title: SiteCore database JDBC port
sitecoreDatabasePort.description: The SiteCore SQL Server port. Typically this is the sql server default of 1433.

sitecoreDatabaseName.title: SiteCore master database name
sitecoreDatabaseName.description: The SiteCore master database's name. Example: sc902_Master

sitecoreDatabaseUsername.title: SiteCore database username
sitecoreDatabaseUsername.description: The SiteCore database username. Only SELECT access is required for this user on the sc*_Master database for these tables: [Items, ArchivedItems, PublishQueue].

sitecoreDatabaseMaxQuerySize.title: SiteCore database query max page size
sitecoreDatabaseMaxQuerySize.description: The maximum number of query results that can be returned from SiteCore database at once.
